page.title: 06FARMS NEAR COATBRIDGE
page.content: Aitkenhead farm make up to{2100 {litres}of milk a week. Drumpark take their cattle down to Ellismuir Farm (owned by them)to be milked,and make up to{4000 litres}of milk. The busiest time on Aitkenhead farm is {winter}and the{first part of June} while the busiest time for Drumpark farm is from{May to July}although they are{busy all year. Aitkenhead farm has no milk floats but, Drumpark has four.The latter sell their milk in{Bargeddie, Baillieston, {Crosshill}and{Gartcosh.}They both use tractors to get across the farm . Mr.Logan owns{Aitkenhead Farm}and Mr. Blackwood and his nephew own {Drumpark Farm. { Aitkenhead}has{160 acres of land}and {Drumpark}has{280 acres.}Aitkenhead employs only{one worker}apart from the owners while Drumpark employs{eight.
